intro: Tontelea divergens, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Tontelea divergens is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in regions with mild climates.
